website_summaries.verdict: A good introductory burr grinder at a low price, but you get what you pay for. Not as consistent or dependable as other grinders.
pros: Works right out of the box and provides 15 grind settings for all different types of espresso creations, including Turkish coffee, which not many grinders do
cons: Complaints of static causing the grinds to fly up and stick to the sides

customer_reviews.title: No more static!
customer_reviews.text: Solved the static problem!!! Use a preserve jar shown in attached photos, fits perfectly inside!! Love this grinder, recommend if you don't want to spend loads!!
customer_reviews.author: Mum to future

customer_reviews.title: Works great, kind of difficult to get clean.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The area surrounding the burr, where the grinds fall through and empty into the cup, is kind of hard to clean. You have to run a brush up through the dispensing hole to clean out grinds and you never really know if it is completely clean because you can't disassemble the machine completely. I do the best I can and so far I haven't noticed a bad taste in my coffee from old stale grinds I couldn't get to. I've used this grinder for a month now, and overall I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G.

customer_reviews.title: A Best Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Our first conical coffee bean grinder! Huge difference from previous flat burr grinders (beware: the Krups GVX212 is not a conical grinder!). With this machine the course grind is visibly consistent and the French press plunge is smooth (no more jamming). Best of all...the coffee is delicious to the last drop (no more chunks of coffee beans or sludge at the bottom of our cups). We're in a dry climate and there's no static issues with this machine (we only grind dark roasts which may help). Other pros: compact, solid construction, easy to clean and quieter than our previous machines. All in all...a winner for course grinding!!
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Been using it for a month now and have gone through about 6lbs of coffee been. Made Vietnamese phin style brew. Works like a charm. Will update...
customer_reviews.author: Tuan

customer_reviews.title: It keeps on grinding!
customer_reviews.text: I had it for a year and it's perfect. I bought another one last month for my son and daughter in law!
customer_reviews.author: Cedarcrab

customer_reviews.title: Good Design-Early Electronic Failure-Great Customer Service from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: We like the product and were surprised when Amazon delivered it on July 4th-only one day after it was ordered. Unfortunately the grinder stopped working properly after seven weeks. It would no longer stay on for the prescribed time. It would run for a one second burst. We contacted Amazon by E-mail and received a replacement less than one day later on a Sunday. We are hoping that the early electronic failure will not be repeated. If so, we would need to downgrade the review to one star for lack of longevity. Amazon performed well, the product design is good, the reliability of the component parts may be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Miata 2003

customer_reviews.title: Terrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 12/20/16 and died on 4/6/17 ... not even used for four months ... and was given as a Christmas gift! Now I can't return it and am stuck trying to find someone to repair it, or toss it and start over. A terrible purchase on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good consistent grind. Beware the static electricity.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to use. Consistently perfect grind. Serious static electricity issues. I “solve” it by grinding what I need and letting it sit for a bit. Otherwise the ground coffee literally explodes out of the plastic cup.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it could get the espresso gring slightly smaller. Other than that, its a good quality grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Tunia

customer_reviews.title: Smells Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: It is not clear how to the set the grind i.e. fine, espresso, coarse. Otherwise it’s a nice little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder. Does a very good job of grinding ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder. Does a very good job of grinding consistently, from fine to coarse. Horrible to clean however. The bean bin and collection container can be removed and washed. But there's no way to clean in the area where the grinding cone is mounted, nor in the areas where the ground coffee travels from the grinding cone to the collection container. If the vendor fixed that issue I would give this 5 stars all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just learned about this type of product. Outstanding. Easy to use and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: BrenIris

customer_reviews.title: espresso grind, look no further
customer_reviews.text: the only reasonably priced conical burr grinder for fine espresso
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Much quieter than I thought it would be for a conical burr and very adjustable. It's good to have the timer, so once you know what number to select for how strong you like your coffee, you can grind the same amount every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great easy ship. Grinds precisely and fast. When used with quality beans, it's the best thing I've purchased for daily use!
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not fine enough for espresso
customer_reviews.text: For this price I should've received a grinder that would work very well for espresso, this one does not.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson R.

customer_reviews.title: Year of heavy use, still working
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews, I was expecting a short lifespan out of this. However, it's been working great for over a year, with heavy daily use. There are much better grinders out there, but considering its price, giving this five stars.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I feel this grinder is quieter than others, it grind our coffee perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bharrison

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I loved this grinder so much that I bought one for my parents, who also love it. For a conical burr grinder, it makes very little mess and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, low-level noise, nice features and grind selection. Easy to use and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: ValentinaCD

customer_reviews.title: Not work the money
customer_reviews.text: Ground the coffee ok but quit after two years and won't start up again.
customer_reviews.author: Schnabinator

customer_reviews.title: For the perfect cuppa
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly ground every time, perfect coffee every time. If you love coffee this grinder could change your life.
customer_reviews.author: The Boccias

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this grinder for about 10 months now, and am very happy with it. Very easy to use and makes a good uniform grind. No problems whatsoever with this grinder, even with daily use. Easy to clean and powerful, great value for a conical burr grinder. For those who get annoyed by "static cling", try using dark roast coffee, that seems to mostly eliminate that "problem". Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this grinder. It isn't the fanciest conical burr grinder, but it has done its job several times a day for over a year already and is priced very well. I would definitely recommend this to the casual barista who grinds for himself on a daily basis. I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Don Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: It was satisfied with it until the problems started
customer_reviews.text: I bought the grinder and used it maybe 15 times and started having problems with it. First it started "cutting" the electricity supply and grind only for a couple of seconds. Then simply stopped working and nothing happened from power button. It was satisfied with it until the problems started. I probably just had bad luck. However trying a different brand next.
customer_reviews.author: Vuorensola Juha-Mikko

customer_reviews.title: I really like it so far but it does make a mess ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it so far but it does make a mess sometimes when you remove the ground coffee, more seems to spill out and not be contained in the receptacle.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 conical burr grinders and 1 flat burr grinder and this is the loudest of them all. It does a good job, but the static build-up is a real PIA and makes keeping things clean a definite issue. We haven't ground our usual oily beans yet so we shall see how that goes. Our previous Baratza Encore grinder also has some issues with coffee grounds being scattered so it is inherent to the breed. Hopefully this one will last longer than the Encore. It does use the same nylon lugs to move the ground coffee out of the grinding area and those are what wore out on the Encore, so they do bear watching.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lett

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my mom. She loves it. Uses it every day to make Turkish coffee. Never had problems with it now for 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: hisham Saikali

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with this grinder but as time has passed it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for just over a year, purchased Dec. 2013. I was pleased with this grinder but as time has passed it has not held up. At this point you have to continually shake the grinder in order to get the beans to feed into the hopper... For this price point I'll get another Krups when this one finally dies....
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got an espresso machine for Christmas and the grinder I had was just getting it too coarse. I work in a coffee shop, so it was driving me nuts since I know what it should look like. This grinder fixed everything! There are so many coarse adjustments so it should be a good grinder for just about anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Its easy and fun to use. It is helping to make our coffee experience that much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like this grinder a lot. Easy to use; but, the static it creates makes it difficult to clean without disassembling it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Yates

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Really great grinder for the 2 months it worked. Then one day - it quit working. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only complaint is that even in the funnest setting (extra fine) the coffee is not fine enough for an espresso shot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder about a 18 months ago. My. Only complaint is that even in the finnest setting (extra fine) the coffee is not fine enough for an espresso shot. Is still too course. I have been using it, it works, but should be way smaller particles. Haven't had any issues so far but a disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: I. Pollak

customer_reviews.title: Love my Burr Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I recently burned out a blade grinder, and went to amazon to do my research on burr grinders, because I read they were better. although I've only had this grinder a couple of months, I love this grinder! It's fast and consistant. Much quieter than my old grinder. I've used this grinder more often than I had that old one!Would have given a 5 star, but it sometimes has a static cling issue when dumping the grinds into the pot, and my hand is sprinkled w/ grinds.I tap on it before I dump now, which lessens the spray, and I'm okay w/ that. Overall, I'm extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: The burr kept getting clogged up and after grinding a tablespoon or so that fell into the cup, it wouldn't grind any more. You had to take it apart, clear out the beans, put it back together and grind another tablespoon of ground coffee and clean it out again.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Item stopped working after only a few uses. Just ...
customer_reviews.text: Item stopped working after only a few uses. Just makes high pitched whirring noise and does no grinding. Espressione's website contains no warranty information, and calling their customer service is a joke. Avoid products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Puterbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grind. Terrible clean-up!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quiet machine and makes the beans the perfect grind size.....BUT it's a pain to clean. Machine must be cleaned after each use. It takes 20 minutes to fully clean the item. Beans and Grinds are stuck in the item. Grind dust is flying everywhere. There isnt any easy way to make sure the all the grinds have fully emptied the item. Plus the beans don't move smoothly into the grinder....so you have to check and slightly jar the grinder to make the beans move, otherwise the motor is burning up and you can smell the motor burning without anything to grind. We've had the item for 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Mama of 2

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST coffee grinder out there
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST coffee grinder out there! My hubby got it as a surprise gift to me and it is amazing. My coffee tastes so much better!
customer_reviews.author: RogandNell

customer_reviews.title: died in a month
customer_reviews.text: we are a family of two moderate coffee drinkers - i pull 8 shots in the morning, once a day every day. this grinder couldn't take it and died. made slowing noises within the first few weeks of use and finally quit. Tried to return it to amazon, but i'm just past the returns window. stupid machine. need to contact amazon, look for a new coffee grinder, all without coffee.
customer_reviews.author: mesays

customer_reviews.title: No good for Turkish coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn'd grind thin enough required for Turkish coffee. Other settings are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Borsha

customer_reviews.title: not bad, but one annoying issue
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my cheap Cuisinart burr grinder with this one as a birthday gift for myself. It is a quiet machine and grinds the beans just fine, but it seems like i constantly have to shake it to get the beans to go through the grinder. It's not a very heavy machine and i feel like I'm going to break it every time i have to shake it back and forth to get the beans to grind. A decent product, but for the money, i might look elsewhere for something with more girth.
customer_reviews.author: zelzah

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect addition to my collection of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect addition to my collection of coffee ,grinder, coffee roaster and brewer.it works great it's a. Little more noisier than the first one I had , take into consideration that this a professional grinder. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: fernando espriu

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Good grinder for the money. Grinds very evenly and isn't as loud as others I've seen. My only complaint is that there doesn't seem to be a big difference between the settings. Either way it works fine for both my french press and my drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in March 2015 and it is already broken.
customer_reviews.author: james R. Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grinder
customer_reviews.text: While this is a little big, it works very well. A little noisy, but it is fast and efficient. The economical cost and pros outweigh the limited slight cons. I still love it! July 1, 2013 - This is still working great - have had no issues. Still love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: rescue an animal

customer_reviews.title: ... was purchased for a gift and the recipient was pleased with the
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased for a gift and the recipient was pleased with the gift
customer_reviews.author: S. Nor

customer_reviews.title: Great for the daily grind -- still trying to figure out howto not make a mess with the grinds
customer_reviews.text: This is a good entry level grinder. We've used it daily, for the last month during COVID. I like that i can just grab a bag of beans from Costco or a local roaster like Zeke's and grind what we need for a fresh carafe each morning. The burr grinder is consistent. It does create static in the grinds, however, and I've yet to come up with a way to not make a small mess after putting the fresh grind into the pot. (a little grinds goes a long way on making a mess). Overall though, if you're on the fence for a decent, functional, grinder like I was, this will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: William Gibson-not the author

customer_reviews.title: Still running beautifully after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is amazing have had over 4 years and it is still doing a great job grinding my coffee beans every morning. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Alder Joe

customer_reviews.title: Super grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Looks kind of plasticy in the picture. Better looking in real life than in the picture. The light gray front is actually more of a silver color. The grind is fantastic. Very even. I use it with a Delonghi 15 bar machine. The finest setting was so fine it clogged my portafilter and stopped the espresso machine. I now use 4 settings up from the finest and works/tastes great. I was surprised how much the flavor of the coffee changed with just a single click of the fineness setting. The grinder sounds serious when it runs. No louder than my other burr grinders, just a nice solid sounding rumble. Feels like it will last (hope).
customer_reviews.author: David M. Mounce

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: First off, it delivered less than 24 hours, crazy fast! The grind is way better than the Cuisinart flat grinder I had. More consistent and finer grind. As far as durability, we will see—that’s why I buy the Auserion agreement
customer_reviews.author: pal

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little machine; quiet and fast. I can't say anything about its durability because I've only had it for a week or so, but assuming it's durable, I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ingersoll1969

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It’s big and works great. It says u can set the grind by number, whether u want coarse or fine. It is adjustable but I don’t see any numbers on the machine ... experimenting gets u there.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Anti-Static
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is great to use - the coarse grind could be a little coarser, but it still works OK in a french press. Seems like a very well built machine that won't break down anytime soon. However, one of the main reasons I purchased this one was because it was supposed to come with an anti-static grounds container for the grounds, and mine definitely does have static and clinging grounds even after I tap it a few times to get the grounds out. But overall I'm very happy with this grinder so five stars it is, as I don't feel that the static is worth taking a star off.
customer_reviews.author: Cheffy

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder and Great Value
customer_reviews.text: In searching for a replacement burr grinder I read the reviews on this unit and decided to give it a try. I'm so happy that I did, it's quieter than other units, has 15 settings which allows me to grind 2-10 cups (something missing from other grinders). The only enhancement I would like to have is a brighter/larger "arrow" on the bean cup as it's hard to see for choosing the grind setting. Otherwise, I highly recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: M Bear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee grinder at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Been using it now for about a month. Consistent and controllable grind quality, at a very competitive price. Good capacity and easy to clean. Plus all the advantages of buying through Amazon. I know, sounds like a advertisement, but it >IS< a very good grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Dag

customer_reviews.title: Good Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: The first one be we ordered stopped working, but they sent a new one right away. The replacement is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Tlusty

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, but...
customer_reviews.text: My only issue, and it IS minor, is that there should have been added some way to stir the beans a little. As the beans grind, gravity alone sometimes isn't enough to replenish and you have to tap it a few times to continue grinding. Not entirely 'push button, walk away'
customer_reviews.author: michael d adkisson

customer_reviews.title: Good Grinder, Durable, and tip to discharge static charge from grinding
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this grinder daily for more than a year. I might give 5 stars if I were more expert with comparative use versus other grinders. The only negative is that static electricity builds up, causing the grounds to disperse when emptying the bin. However, I want to share the remedy: Remove the bin, lid on, and touch against your water faucet. Plumbing is grounded, so the charge is reduced and the bin empties cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. We've owned this for about 6 months now
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. We've owned this for about 6 months now. It's not quiet, but then, it's a coffee grinder. The "anti-static" plastic doesn't seem to be particularly "anti-static" but overall this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dhoelzer

customer_reviews.title: A solid product
customer_reviews.text: The machine is simple and effective. The grind is even and reliable in almost every level of grind (coarse to extra fine). The machine has good options for settings for its price. No complaints on cosmetics. Looks professional and classic.
customer_reviews.author: AMH3

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works nicely.. gets caught up occasionally and has to be given a lite shake to get the beans thru and it can sound like a jet taking off in the quiet of the morning. However, it grinds wonderfully, holds a good swell of beans and looks nice
customer_reviews.author: L Reid

customer_reviews.title: Better than some of the better known grinders
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for another more famous brand and this is a far superior model. Easy to clean, good capacity, and well designed (in Italy).
customer_reviews.author: zebweb

customer_reviews.title: Great unit with a few caveats.
customer_reviews.text: Works great but very noisy. And I've never seen static in a coffee grinder until I got this unit. Makes a great grind but the static makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Grinder Ever
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Nearly all coffee bean grinders leave small grind residue all over the place and have to be cleaned often. This one doesn't make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for static electricity!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works great, however, the coffee is full of static after grinding and sticks to the container, the counter, my clothes, and clings to all the surfaces of the coffeemaker. It is like working with magnets and metal shavings. I keep thinking about getting rid of it because I cannot stop the static. I have tried using a damp sponge on all the surfaces, to no avail. Our house is not full of static, so I have no explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fine grinder, creates too much static and mess.
customer_reviews.text: Not exceptionally noisy, about the same as others. Makes a mess though due to static buildup when it grinds.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklynpk

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder with many different settings but not as quiet as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: E. Renslow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and it works beautifully...Would recommend looking at this item when purchasing a coffee grinder...
customer_reviews.author: Nancy R

customer_reviews.title: Great..
customer_reviews.text: Great ... except the very common static problem ... that is a pain and a mess on the counter every day :(
customer_reviews.author: FisherFarm

customer_reviews.title: messy
customer_reviews.text: I like the grinder itself because it has a more heavy duty motor and blades. What I don't like is how the coffee flies around while you are grinding. The container is so full of static that when you go to empty it, it flies around more and gets all over the place. Don't think that I would have spent this much money for a kitchen grinder. Next time I will research better
customer_reviews.author: Patti Watson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week
customer_reviews.text: I used it 4 times at the most and then the grinder stopped turning. It wasn't jammed. What a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: kathleen a sears

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned it because it was inoperable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: David V

customer_reviews.title: bad grinder and warranty
customer_reviews.text: Grinder stopped grinding coffee and then the warranty company sent it back not repaired. A bad experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: What a Horrible Mess
customer_reviews.text: What a mess! Due to static electricity, the newly ground coffee sticks to the plastic on the grinder, then spreads everywhere. It takes 15 minutes to clean up the kitchen every time I use this product. Before I grind, I get my hand vac. It still takes 15 minutes to clean the kitchen. If you like cleaning up messes, get this grinder. If you don't, get one made with glass...or resign yourself to a filthy kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Rohde

product_meta.title: Espressione Professional Conical Burr Coffee Grinder, Black/Silver
product_meta.description: Espressione's commercial quality grinder stands out from the rest with its powerful grinding conical mechanism and precision controlled engineering. Large 8.5 ounce hopper and 15 levels of grinding all provide convenience and versatility. Whether brewing coffee or making an espresso the grinder can complete the job fast. The finest setting is ideal for preparing Turkish coffee, which is a rare feature to find in a grinder. A built-in timer with quantity measure can make from 2 to 10 cups in a matter of seconds and will stop automatically when ready. Espressione Professional Conical Burr Coffee Grinder has an advanced conical burr design to reduce the amount of friction and heat thus preserving coffee flavor and aroma. The coffee container holds up to 4 ounces of grounds and remains sealed during grinding and is anti-static. Superior functions and smart design make Espressione Professional Conical Burr Coffee Grinder the ideal commercial quality grinder for your home and office. Review page number 5 of User manual for trouble shooting steps.
feature_bullets: Commercial grade conical burrs, rotary selector with auto stop function, sturdy construction with slip resistant bottom and power cord wind feature
15 grind settings, transparent bean container with large 8-1/2 ounce capacity for whole bean coffee
Anti-static transparent container holds 4 ounces of ground coffee

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars166 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
